beer.beer_description: One of the finest examples of German Pilsner. Veltins Pilsener (4.8% ABV) is brewed using natural spring water from its own mountain. It has a delicate dry and clean palate, fine carbonated body, slight bitterness and a light citrus finish. Brewed in Sauerland, near Dortmund, to the German Purity Law 1516. Voted 'World's Best Pilsner' in the 2007 World Beer Awards.

The power of pilsner! Part of our first round of “Super Style” badges in 2023, celebrate this crisp, clean lager, which ranked as the 10th most checked-in style of 2021 with over 1M check-ins. AVAILABLE ONLY TO UNTAPPD INSIDERS.

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 430 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 87!
Light and crisp, a Pilsner is all you need to make your day great. Though, perhaps another one would make it even better. That’s 215 different Pilsners. Try 5 more for Level 44!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 35 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 8!
